votebox.events

Class VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • votebox.events.VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector

  • public class VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    The VoteBoxAuditoriumConnecter is the "middleman" that starts an instance of Auditorium, handles the VoteBox messaging protocol, and generates events to the application.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private AuditoriumHost auditorium 
      private VoteBoxEventMatcher matcher 
      private VoteBoxEventNotifier notifier 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector(int serial, IAuditoriumParams params, MatcherRule... rules)
      Constructs a new VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector with the given serial number and matcher rules to check against incoming announcements.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(VoteBoxEventListener l)
      Adds a listener for VoteBox events.
      void announce(IAnnounceEvent e)
      Broadcasts an announcement on the auditorium network.
      void connect()
      Attempts to connect to an auditorium by running discover once.
      void connect(int delay, int repeats)
      Attempts to connect to an auditorium, and if no hosts are discovered, will wait a number of seconds and then try again
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the auditorum network.
      private void initEventThread()
      Runs continuously in a dedicated thread for auditorium events for which this instance is configured to hear (to hear a specific event, the events Matcher Rule must be sent in as part of the constructor's arguments)
      void removeListener(VoteBoxEventListener l)
      Removes a listener from the list of VoteBox event listeners.

    • Constructor Detail

      • VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector

        public VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector(int serial,
                          IAuditoriumParams params,
                          MatcherRule... rules)
                           throws NetworkException
        Constructs a new VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector with the given serial number and matcher rules to check against incoming announcements.
        Parameters:
        serial - this machine's serial number
        params - parameters for configuring the connector
        rules - the matchers for messages this machine needs
        Throws:
        NetworkException

    • Method Detail

      • addListener

        public void addListener(VoteBoxEventListener l)
        Adds a listener for VoteBox events. The listeners are called in the order that they are added.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(VoteBoxEventListener l)
        Removes a listener from the list of VoteBox event listeners.
        Parameters:
        l - the listener

      • connect

        public void connect()
             throws NetworkException
        Attempts to connect to an auditorium by running discover once.
        Throws:
        NetworkException

      • connect

        public void connect(int delay,
           int repeats)
             throws NetworkException
        Attempts to connect to an auditorium, and if no hosts are discovered, will wait a number of seconds and then try again
        Parameters:
        delay - the wait time in between repeats
        repeats - the number of repeats (-1 to repeat forever)
        Throws:
        NetworkException

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Disconnects from the auditorum network.

      • announce

        public void announce(IAnnounceEvent e)
        Broadcasts an announcement on the auditorium network. The event is then fired, as if this node had heard the announcement from someone else. All code that reacts to a message, whether sent by this machine or another, should always exist in the listeners that are registered to the VoteBoxAuditoriumConnector. This allows for an abstraction based on who sent the message.
        Parameters:
        e - the event to announce

      • initEventThread

        private void initEventThread()
        Runs continuously in a dedicated thread for auditorium events for which this instance is configured to hear (to hear a specific event, the events Matcher Rule must be sent in as part of the constructor's arguments)
